contentrichtext.text: '''Ala Abdessaheb al-Alwan''' (born 1949) was Minister of Education in the cabinet appointed by the [[Interim Iraq Governing Council]] in September 2003, and Minister of Health in the [[Iraqi Interim Government]]. He left Iraq in 2005 back to the [[World Health Organization]] (WHO) as Assistant Director General based in [[Geneva, Switzerland]]. A [[Shia]] Muslim and native of [[Baghdad]], al-Alwan was dean of the College of Medicine at [[Al-Mustansiriya University]], Baghdad until 1992, when he joined the staff of the WHO. At the WHO he served as Director of Health Services for the Eastern Mediterranean Region, WHO Representative in Oman and Jordan, and the Director of the Department of Noncommunicable Diseases at WHO headquarters in Geneva. ==References== *{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3199561.stm|title=Iraq's post-war cabinet|accessdate=2006-02-24|author=BBC News| date=2003-09-01}} *{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3766401.stm|author=BBC News|title=Interim Iraqi government|accessdate=2006-02-24 | date=2004-06-01| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20060125051123/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/3766401.stm| archivedate= 25 January 2006 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} {{s-start}} {{succession box | title=Minister of Health| before=[[Coalition Provisional Authority]]| years= September 2003–June 2004| after=[[Sami Mudahfar]] }} {{succession box | title=Minister of Health| before=[[Khodayyir Abbas]]| years=June 2004–May 2005| after=[[Abdel Muttalib Mohammed Ali]] }} {{s-end}} {{Persondata | NAME = al-Alwan, Alaa Abdessaheb | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Iraqi and international politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1949 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alwan, Alaa Abdessaheb al-}} [[Category:1949 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Iraqi academics]] [[Category: People in public health]] [[Category:Government ministers of Iraq]] [[Category:People from Baghdad]] [[Category:Iraqi Shia Muslims]] [[Category:Al-Mustansiriya University faculty]] [[Category:World Health Organization officials]] {{Iraq-politician-stub}} {{Iraq-academic-bio-stub}}
